intro: Myrsine capitellata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually smaller than those of the typical variety. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are used in traditional medicine and are also valued for their ornamental qualities.
